snippet: In the past 50 years, meat has gotten less fatty and easier to chew — thanks in part to the U.S. Meat Animal Research Center. But the achievement has come at a steep cost to the lab’s animals.
abstract: US Meat Animal Research Center in Nebraska has re-engineered farm animals with several distinct market advantages, but changes have come at cruel cost for the animals; taxpayer-funded research has yielded less costly animals with more offspring and leaner and more plentiful meat, but many of them are born weakened and deformed, dying in huge numbers or living brief lives of intense suffering.
lead_paragraph: In the past 50 years, meat has gotten less fatty and easier to chew — thanks in part to the U.S. Meat Animal Research Center. But the achievement has come at a steep cost to the lab’s animals.

headline.seo: Animal Welfare at Risk in Experiments for Meat Industry
headline.main: U.S. Research Lab Lets Livestock Suffer in Quest for Profit
